import React from 'react'; import './App.css'; import './main.css'; import { Container, Row, Col } from 'react-bootstrap'; import {Route, NavLink, HashRouter, BrowserRouter } from "react-router-dom"; import Latest from "./Latest"; import Publications from "./Publications"; import Projects from "./Projects"; import Misc from "./Misc"; function App() { return (

Kevin Feng

— HCI researcher and PhD student

I'm a first-year PhD student in the Human Centered Design & Engineering department at the University of Washington, currently rotating with David W. McDonald. My interests are in human-AI interaction, specifically the intersection of user experience and machine learning. I’m motivated by the following observation: there is increasing need to understand and evaluate UX of ML systems as they are deployed into new domains, but key stakeholders are unprepared to do so with current tools and processes.

I graduated from Princeton University with a B.S.E. in Computer Science and a minor in Visual Arts in 2021. At Princeton, I was affiliated with the CITP and worked with Arunesh Mathur and Arvind Narayanan on tools to democratize web advertisement research at scale. I also spent some time doing research at the MIT Media Lab, University of Chicago’s AIR Lab, and the Smart Systems Institute at the National University of Singapore.

I'm a student at Princeton University thinking about technological interfaces and different ways people can interact with them to arrive at new conclusions. I aspire to use code, design, data, and new ideas to make people's communities at least marginally nicer to be in.
